overview: Students will undergo extensive research training with their own individually supervised research project in the field of biochemistry or pharmacology under the supervision of a member of the Department or affiliated institution, acquiring skills in experimental design, technical expertise, critical thinking, analysis and interpretation, and communication. Research projects will be offered in a wide variety of research areas allowing students to choose a topic that interests them. Students will learn how to communicate their science in oral presentations and thesis writing.
ilo: Select, summarise and critically appraise published research in biochemistry or pharmacology
Formulate a research hypothesis based upon a synthesis of the published research evidence
Design and undertake appropriate research experiments to answer a research hypothesis in biochemistry or pharmacology
Conduct supervised research in a specific area of biochemistry or pharmacology research
Communicate the methods and findings of a research project in oral and written form
Interpret and critically evaluate novel research findings
generic_skills: critical analysis of the scientific literature
